they rushed in an irregular but joyous and eager crowd down the hill at their disordered foe. 
THE ATTACK of the Sixth Chasseurs secured the retreat of our right flank. In the center Tu- shin's forgotten battery, which had managed to set fire to theSchon Grabern village, delayed the French advance. The French were putting out the fire which the wind was spreading, and thus gave us time to retreat. The retirement of the center to the other side of the dip in the ground at the rear was hurried
